intro: Chylismia brevipes subsp. pallidula, commonly known as the pale-flowered chylismia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The species is distinguished by its pale pink to white flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils in forested areas, often forming dense shrubs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
